title: Bioregistry JSON Schema
description: The Bioregistry JSON Schema describes the shapes of the objects in the registry, metaregistry, collections, and their other related resources

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of the researcher

orcid.title: Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier
orcid.description: The Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier (ORCiD) provides researchers with an open, unambiguous identifier for connecting various digital assets (e.g., publications, reviews) across the semantic web. An account can be made in seconds at https://orcid.org.

email.title: Email address
email.description: The email address specific to the researcher.

github.title: GitHub handle
github.description: The GitHub handle enables contacting the researcher on GitHub: the *de facto* version control in the computer sciences and life sciences.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: A list of prefixes of resources appearing in the collection

authors.title: Authors
authors.description: A list of authors/contributors to the collection

code.title: Code
code.description: A locally unique code within the prefix for the provider

uri_format.title: URI Format
uri_format.description: The URI format string, which must have at least one ``$1`` in it. Note that this field is generic enough to accept IRIs. See the URI specification (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986) and IRI specification (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3987.txt) for more information.

first_party.title: First Party
first_party.description: Annotates whether a provider is from the first-party organization

Attributable.title: Attributable
Attributable.description: An upper-level metadata for a researcher.

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of the researcher

orcid.title: Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier
orcid.description: The Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier (ORCiD) provides researchers with an open, unambiguous identifier for connecting various digital assets (e.g., publications, reviews) across the semantic web. An account can be made in seconds at https://orcid.org.

email.title: Email address
email.description: The email address specific to the researcher.

github.title: GitHub handle
github.description: The GitHub handle enables contacting the researcher on GitHub: the *de facto* version control in the computer sciences and life sciences.

ror.title: Research Organization Registry identifier
ror.description: ROR identifier for a record about the organization

wikidata.title: Wikidata identifier
wikidata.description: Wikidata identifier for a record about the organization

partnered.title: Partnered
partnered.description: Has this organization made a specific connection with Bioregistry?

pubmed.title: PubMed
pubmed.description: The PubMed identifier for the article

doi.title: DOI
doi.description: The DOI for the article. DOIs are case insensitive, so these are required by the Bioregistry to be standardized to their lowercase form.

pmc.title: PMC
pmc.description: The PubMed Central identifier for the article

year.title: Year
year.description: The year the article was published

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Metadata about an ontology, database, or other resource.

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: The regular expression pattern for local unique identifiers in the resource

uri_format.title: URI format string
uri_format.description: The URI format string, which must have at least one ``$1`` in it. Note that this field is generic enough to accept IRIs. See the URI specification (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986) and IRI specification (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3987.txt) for more information.

uri_format_resolvable.title: URI format string resolvable
uri_format_resolvable.description: If false, denotes if the URI format string is known to be not resolvable

rdf_uri_format.title: RDF URI format string
rdf_uri_format.description: The RDF URI format string, which must have at least one ``$1`` in it. Note that this field is generic enough to accept IRIs. See the URI specification (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986) and IRI specification (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3987.txt) for more information.

providers.title: Providers
providers.description: Additional, non-default providers for the resource

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: The URL for the homepage of the resource, preferably using HTTPS

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: The URL for the repository of the resource

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: The contact email address for the resource. This must correspond to a specific person and not be a listserve nor a shared email account.

owners.title: Owners
owners.description: The owner of the corresponding identifier space. See also https://github.com/biopragmatics/bioregistry/issues/755.

example.title: Example
example.description: An example local identifier for the resource, explicitly excluding any redundant usage of the prefix in the identifier. For example, a GO identifier should only look like ``1234567`` and not like ``GO:1234567``

example_decoys.title: Example Decoys
example_decoys.description: Extra example identifiers that explicitly fail regex tests

part_of.title: Part Of
part_of.description: An annotation between this prefix and a super-prefix. For example, ``chembl.compound`` is a part of ``chembl``.

provides.title: Provides
provides.description: An annotation between this prefix and a prefix for which it is redundant. For example, ``ctd.gene`` has been given a prefix by Identifiers.org, but it actually just reuses identifies from ``ncbigene``, so ``ctd.gene`` provides ``ncbigene``.

download_owl.title: OWL Download URL
download_owl.description: The URL to download the resource as an ontology encoded in the OWL format. More information about this format can be found at https://www.w3.org/TR/owl2-syntax/.

download_obo.title: OBO Download URL
download_obo.description: The URL to download the resource as an ontology encoded in the OBO format. More information about this format can be found at https://owlcollab.github.io/oboformat/doc/obo-syntax.html.

download_json.title: OBO Graph JSON Download URL
download_json.description: The URL to download the resource as an ontology encoded in the OBO Graph JSON format. More information about this format can be found at https://github.com/geneontology/obographs.

download_rdf.title: RDF Download URL
download_rdf.description: The URL to download the resource as an RDF file, in one of many formats.

banana.title: Banana
banana.description: The `banana` is a generalization of the concept of the "namespace embedded in local unique identifier". Many OBO foundry ontologies use the redundant uppercased name of the ontology in the local identifier, such as the Gene Ontology, which makes the prefixes have a redundant usage as in ``GO:GO:1234567``. The `banana` tag explicitly annotates the part in the local identifier that should be stripped, if found. While the Bioregistry automatically knows how to handle all OBO Foundry ontologies' bananas because the OBO Foundry provides the "preferredPrefix" field, the banana can be annotated on non-OBO ontologies to more explicitly write the beginning part of the identifier that should be stripped. This allowed for solving one of the long-standing issues with the Identifiers.org resolver (e.g., for ``oma.hog``; see https://github.com/identifiers-org/identifiers-org.github.io/issues/155) as well as better annotate new entries, such as SwissMap Lipids, which have the prefix ``swisslipid`` but have the redundant information ``SLM:`` in the beginning of identifiers. Therefore, ``SLM:`` is the banana.

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.description: A flag denoting if this resource is deprecated. Currently, this is a blanket term that covers cases when the prefix is no longer maintained, when it has been rolled into another resource, when the website related to the resource goes down, or any other reason that it's difficult or impossible to find full metadata on the resource. If this is set to true, please add a comment explaining why. This flag will override annotations from the OLS, OBO Foundry, and others on the deprecation status, since they often disagree and are very conservative in calling dead resources.

mappings.title: Mappings
mappings.description: A dictionary of metaprefixes (i.e., prefixes for registries) to prefixes in external registries. These also correspond to the registry-specific JSON fields in this model like ``miriam`` field.

synonyms.title: Synonyms
synonyms.description: A list of synonyms for the prefix of this resource. These are used in normalization of prefixes and are a useful reference tool for prefixes that are written many ways. For example, ``snomedct`` has many synonyms including typos like ``SNOWMEDCT``, lexical variants like ``SNOMED_CT``, version-variants like ``SNOMEDCT_2010_1_31``, and tons of other nonsense like ``SNOMEDCTCT``.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: A list of keywords for the resource

references.title: References
references.description: A list of URLs to also see, such as publications describing the resource

publications.title: Publications
publications.description: A list of URLs to also see, such as publications describing the resource

appears_in.title: Appears In
appears_in.description: A list of prefixes that use this resource for xrefs, provenance, etc.

depends_on.title: Depends On
depends_on.description: A list of prefixes that use this resource depends on, e.g., ontologies that import each other.

namespace_in_lui.title: Namespace Embedded in Local Unique Identifier
namespace_in_lui.description: A flag denoting if the namespace is embedded in the LUI (if this is true and it is not accompanied by a banana, assume that the banana is the prefix in all caps plus a colon, as is standard in OBO). Currently this flag is only used to override identifiers.org in the case of ``gramene.growthstage``, ``oma.hog``, and ``vario``.

no_own_terms.title: No Own Terms
no_own_terms.description: A flag denoting if the resource mints its own identifiers. Omission or explicit marking as false means that the resource does have its own terms. This is most applicable to ontologies, specifically application ontologies, which only reuse terms from others. One example is ChIRO.

comment.title: Comment
comment.description: A field for a free text comment

contributor.title: Contributor
contributor.description: The contributor of the prefix to the Bioregistry, including at a minimum their name and ORCiD and optional their email address and GitHub handle. All entries curated through the Bioregistry GitHub Workflow must contain this field.

contributor_extras.title: Contributor Extras
contributor_extras.description: Additional contributors besides the original submitter.

reviewer.title: Reviewer
reviewer.description: The reviewer of the prefix to the Bioregistry, including at a minimum their name and ORCiD and optional their email address and GitHub handle. All entries curated through the Bioregistry GitHub Workflow should contain this field pointing to the person who reviewed it on GitHub.

proprietary.title: Proprietary
proprietary.description: A flag to denote if this database is proprietary and therefore can not be included in normal quality control checks nor can it be resolved. Omission or explicit marking as false means that the resource is not proprietary.

has_canonical.title: Has Canonical
has_canonical.description: If this shares an IRI with another entry, maps to which should be be considered as canonical

preferred_prefix.title: Preferred Prefix
preferred_prefix.description: An annotation of stylization of the prefix. This appears in OBO ontologies like FBbt as well as databases like NCBIGene. If it's not given, then assume that the normalized prefix used in the Bioregistry is canonical.

twitter.title: Twitter
twitter.description: The twitter handle for the project

mastodon.title: Mastodon
mastodon.description: The mastodon handle for the project

github_request_issue.title: Github Request Issue
github_request_issue.description: The GitHub issue for the new prefix request

logo.title: Logo
logo.description: The URL of the logo for the project/resource

name.title: Name
name.description: This field denotes if a name is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: This field denotes if a homepage is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

description.title: Description
description.description: This field denotes if a description is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

example.title: Example
example.description: This field denotes if an example local unique identifier is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: This field denotes if a regular expression pattern for matching local unique identifiers is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: This field denotes if a URI format string for converting local unique identifiers into URIs is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

alternate_providers.title: Alternate Providers
alternate_providers.description: This field denotes if additional/secondary URI format strings for converting local unique identifiers into URIs is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

synonyms.title: Synonyms
synonyms.description: This field denotes if alternative prefixes (e.g., taxonomy for NCBITaxon) is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

license.title: License
license.description: This field denotes if capturing the data license is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

version.title: Version
version.description: This field denotes if capturing the current data version is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: This field denotes if capturing the primary responsible person's contact information (e.g., name, ORCID, email) is required, optional, or never captured for each record in the registry.

search.title: Prefix Search
search.description: This field denotes if the registry provides either a dedicated page for searching for prefixes (e.g. AberOWL has a dedicated search page) OR a contextual search (e.g., AgroPortal has a prefix search built in its homepage).

structured_data.title: Structured Data
structured_data.description: This field denotes if the registry provides structured access to its data? For example, this can be through an API (e.g., FAIRsharing, OLS) or a bulk download (e.g., OBO Foundry) in a structured file format. A counter-example is a site that must be scraped to acquire its content (e.g, the NCBI GenBank).

bulk_data.title: Bulk Data
bulk_data.description: This field denotes if the registry provides a bulk dump of its data? For example, the OBO Foundry provides its bulk data in a file and Identifiers.org provides its bulk data in an API endpoint. A counterexample is FAIRsharing, which requires slow, expensive pagination through its data. Another counterexample is HL7 which requires manually navigating a form to download its content. While GenBank is not structured, it is still bulk downloadable.

no_authentication.title: No Authentication
no_authentication.description: This field denotes if the registry provides access to its data without an API key? For example, Identifiers.org. As a counter-example, BioPortal requires an API key for access to its structured data.

automatable_download.title: Automatable Download
automatable_download.description: This field denotes if the registry makes its data available downloadable in an automated way?This includes websites that have bulk downloads, paginated API downloads, or even require scraping.A counter example is HL7, whose download can not be automated due to the need to interact with a web form.

curates.title: Curates
curates.description: This field denotes if the registry's maintainers and potentially contributors curate novel prefixes.

imports.title: Imports
imports.description: This field denotes if the registry imports and aligns prefixes from other registries.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description: This field denotes the scope of prefixes which the registry covers. For example, some registries are limited to ontologies, some have a full scope over the life sciences, and some are general purpose.

comments.title: Comments
comments.description: Optional additional comments about the registry's governance model

accepts_external_contributions.title: Accepts External Contributions
accepts_external_contributions.description: This field denotes if the registry (in theory) accepts external contributions, either via suggestion or proactive improvement. This field does not pass judgement on the difficult of this process from the perspective of the submitter nor the responsiveness of the registry. This field does not consider the ability for insiders (i.e., people with private relationships to the maintainers) to affect change.

public_version_controlled_data.title: Public Version-Controlled Data
public_version_controlled_data.description: This field denotes if the registry stores its data in publicly available version control system, such as GitHub or GitLab

data_repository.title: Data Repository
data_repository.description: This field denotes the address of the registry's data version control repository.

code_repository.title: Code Repository
code_repository.description: This field denotes the address of the registry's code version control repository.

review_team.title: Review Team
review_team.description: This field denotes if the registry's reviewers/moderators for external contributions known? If there's a well-defined, maintained listing, then it can be marked as public. If it can be inferred, e.g. from reading the commit history on a version control system, then it can be marked as inferrable. A closed review team, e.g., like for Identifiers.org can be marked as private. Resources that do not accept external contributions can be marked with N/A. An unmoderated regitry like Prefix.cc is marked with  'democratic'.

status.title: Status
status.description: This field denotes the maitenance status of the repository. An active repository is still being maintained and also is responsive to external requests for improvement. An unresponsive repository is still being maintained in some capacity but is not responsive to external requests for improvement. An inactive repository is no longer being proactively maintained (though may receive occasional patches).

issue_tracker.title: Issue Tracker
issue_tracker.description: This field denotes the public issue tracker for issues related to the code and data of the repository.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: The metaprefix for the registry itself. For example, the metaprefix for Identifiers.org is `miriam`.

name.title: Name
name.description: The human-readable label for the registry

description.title: Description
description.description: A full description of the registry.

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: The URL for the homepage of the registry.

example.title: Example
example.description: An example prefix inside the registry.

bibtex.title: Bibtex
bibtex.description: Citation key used in BibTex for this registry.

availability.title: Availability
availability.description: A structured description of the metadata that the registry collects

qualities.title: Qualities
qualities.description: A structured description of the registry's qualities

governance.title: Governance
governance.description: A structured description of the governance for the registry

download.title: Download
download.description: A download link for the data contained in the registry

provider_uri_format.title: Provider Uri Format
provider_uri_format.description: A URL with a $1 for a prefix to resolve in the registry

search_uri_format.title: Search Uri Format
search_uri_format.description: A URL with a $1 for a prefix or string for searching for prefixes

resolver_uri_format.title: Resolver Uri Format
resolver_uri_format.description: A URL with a $1 for a prefix and $2 for an identifier to resolve in the registry

resolver_type.title: Resolver Type
resolver_type.description: An optional type annotation for what kind of resolver it is (i.e., redirect or lookup)

bioregistry_prefix.title: Bioregistry Prefix
bioregistry_prefix.description: The prefix for this registry in the Bioregistry

logo_url.title: Logo Url
logo_url.description: The URL for the logo of the resource

license.title: License
license.description: The license under which the resource is redistributed

short_name.title: Short Name
short_name.description: A short name for the resource, e.g., for use in charts

Context.title: Context
Context.description:
A prescriptive context contains configuration for generating fit-for-purpose
prefix maps to serve various communities based on the standard Bioregistry
prefix map, custom prefix remapping rules, custom URI prefix remapping rules,
custom prefix maps, and other community-specific logic.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the context, can include Markdown

maintainers.title: Maintainers
maintainers.description: A list of maintainers for the context

prefix_priority.title: Prefix Priority
prefix_priority.description: This ordering of metaprefixes (i.e., prefixes for registries) is used to determine the priority of which registry's prefixes are used. By default, the canonical Bioregistry prefixes are highest priority. Add in "preferred" for explicitly using preferred prefixes or "default" for explicitly using Bioregistry canonical prefixes.

include_synonyms.title: Include Synonyms
include_synonyms.description: Should synonyms be included in the prefix map?

uri_prefix_priority.title: Uri Prefix Priority
uri_prefix_priority.description: This ordering of metaprefixes (i.e., prefixes for registries) is used to determine the priority of which registry's URI prefixes are used. By default, the canonical Bioregistry URI prefixes are highest priority.

prefix_remapping.title: Prefix Remapping
prefix_remapping.description: This is a mapping from canonical Bioregistry prefixes to custom prefixes used in this context.

custom_prefix_map.title: Custom Prefix Map
custom_prefix_map.description: This is a custom prefix map (which contains custom URL/URI expansions) that is added after all other logic is applied. Keys must either be canonical Bioregistry prefixes, prefixes used based on the given prefix priority, or values in the given prefix remapping.

blacklist.title: Blacklist
blacklist.description: This is a list of canonical Bioregistry prefixes that should not be included in the context.
